org.fpe4j

Interface FFX.ArithmeticFunction

  • Enclosing class:
    FFX

    protected static interface FFX.ArithmeticFunction
    The arithmetic functions for the [+] and [-] operations in the Feistel rounds.
    Author:
    Kai Johnson

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[] add(int[] X, int[] Y)
      Add Y to X
      int[] subtract(int[] X, int[] Y)
      Subtract Y from X

    • Method Detail

      • add

        int[] add(int[] X,
          int[] Y)
        Add Y to X
        Parameters:
        X - the first operand with elements in the range [0..radix]
        Y - the second operand with elements in the range [0..radix]
        Returns:
        the result of X [+] Y with length = X.length = Y.length and elements each in the range [0..radix]
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if X or Y is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if X.length != Y.length, or if any X[i] or Y[i] is not in the range [0..radix]

      • subtract

        int[] subtract(int[] X,
               int[] Y)
        Subtract Y from X
        Parameters:
        X - the first operand with elements in the range [0..radix]
        Y - the second operand with elements in the range [0..radix]
        Returns:
        the result of X [-] Y with length = X.length = Y.length and elements each in the range [0..radix]
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if X.length != Y.length, or if any X[i] or Y[i] is not in the range [0..radix]
